response.question: data types present in javascript?
response.answer: String, Number, Boolean, Undefined, Null, Object

response.question: Hoisting in javascript
response.answer: Hoisting is the default behaviour of javascript where all the variable and function declarations are moved on top

response.question: Difference between “ == “ and “ === “ operators.
response.answer: Both are comparison operators. The difference between both the operators is that “==” is used to compare values whereas, “ === “ is used to compare both values and types.

response.question: Difference between var and let keyword in javascript.
response.answer: var has function scope and will be hoisted, let has some block scope and it will not be hoisted

response.question: What is Spread Operator
response.answer: Spread operator allows iterables( arrays / objects / strings ) to be expanded into single arguments/elements

response.question: What are ES6 features
response.answer: let and const Keywords,Arrow Functions,Multi-line Strings,Default Parameters,Template Literals,Destructuring Assignment,Enhanced Object Literals,Promises,Classes,Modules

response.question: What are the features of JavaScript
response.answer:
Lightweight, interpreted programming language,Cross-platform compatible,Open-source,Object-oriented,Integration with other backend and frontend technologies,
                        Used especially for the development of network-based applications

response.question: What is Callback in JavaScript
response.answer: In JavaScript, functions are objects and therefore, functions can take other functions as arguments and can also be returned by other functions.

response.question: What are the arrow functions in JavaScript
response.answer: Arrow functions are a short and concise way of writing functions in JavaScript

response.question: What are template literals in es6
response.answer: Template literals help make it simple to do string interpolation, or to include variables in a string.It represents in backticks
